Class FootballGame

java.lang.Object
Game
FootballGame
public class FootballGame
extends Game
This class has a two-argument constructor, 1 private variable and two override protected methods.
Author:
Max Finch

  • Field Details

    • period

      private final java.lang.String period
      Maintains the period type for Football. This variable IS final because we don't need the period type to change for Football.

  • Constructor Details

    • FootballGame

      public FootballGame​(java.lang.String homeTeam, java.lang.String awayTeam)
      Two-argument constructor. Calls the Game constructor to set team names. Decides if overtime is allowed. Sets the maximum period amount. Sets the score types for the game.
      Parameters:
      homeTeam - name of homeTeam
      awayTeam - name of awayTeam

  • Method Details

    • selectPlay

      protected void selectPlay​(int selection)
      This method selects the option the scorer selects and updates the game score or period accordingly.
      Specified by:
      selectPlay in class Game
      Parameters:
      selection - the type of score or period switch the scorer would like to record.

    • getPeriodOfPlay

      protected java.lang.String getPeriodOfPlay()
      All subclasses MUST implement this method. Although all implementations are the same, the String (period) found in the default subclasses (except for BaseballGame) are final variables. Therefore, we cannot implement getPeriodOfPlay() in the Game class.
      Specified by:
      getPeriodOfPlay in class Game
      Returns:
      String value signifying the current period of play.
